title: Beautiful Glass and Architecture
review: This Palace inside Agra Fort is stunning. The Palace was built by Mughal Shahjahan between 1631-40. The stunning glass was imported from Syria to make a high mirror effect and it is beautiful giving a high light quality. Beautiful inlaid work in marble too.

title: stunning architecture
review: we were told by our guide that the ceiling was made up of special curved glass brought all the way from Belgium, the only place producing glass like that at that time.  I think the 16 century.  the light reflecting off the glass would cast different hues around the room at different times of day.

title: Beautiful Glass Structure inside Agra Fort
review: The Sheesh Mahal is a beautiful palace located inside Agra Fort. I think this the most beautiful one in side the Agra Fort. Now-a-days none can go in inside to see it's beauty but you can see from outside through the grilled gate.

title: Fine glass mosaics as a change
review: In Rajasthan you might become a bit spoiled by all fantastic pietra dura mosaics. These glittering glass mosaics are a nice change. Must have looked magic during festive nights lighted by candles.

title: Stunning

title: Agra Fort

Having him point out how they carved the marble and then inlaid with the semi-precious stones was great. The combination of the wonderful workmanship and a detailed history of India during this timeframe really enhanced our visit.

This time I have observed that all the places of interest in Agra & Delhi is cordoned and you can not go inside most of the places. This may have been done for the security of visitors. But when I visited the places during my childhood, everything was approachable - so I am not disappointed knowing fully well that this for security purpose of both upkeep of monuments and for the he public c visiting them.

title: The Real wonder Inside Taj Mahal
review: The masterpiece art work is just Jaw Dropping I would recommend to take tour guide to take more details.

title: Sheesh Mahal, Amber Fort

title: wonderful

title: An Engineering Marvel worth seeing.
review: An engineering marvel amazing structure it will captivate the visitors a good guide will explain to you the finer aspect of this great place

title: stunning work of art
review: Breath taking mirror like mosaic!  It is one of the most beautiful palaces to visit in Agra.

title: Creativity at its best
review: Sheesh Mahal, or the Palace of Mirrors, is situated in the Agra Fort. It is one of the most artistic examples of architecture that you will find anywhere in the world.

title: Unbelievable creativity
review: This is a place cannot be missed.  it was created hundreds of years ago and its still standing and the beauty of it is beyond description

title: Another piece of mughal masterpiece in architecture
review: Visiting this incredible monument, which is inside the super impressive Agra Fort - which was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty until 1638, when the capital was shifted to Delhi. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and about 2.5km from its more famous sister monument the Taj Mahal, was simply jaw dropping. The attention to detail of the works on the tiles, the mirrors, the wonderful Calligraphy, the floor tiles are just so sensational. The Sheesh Mahal was also built by Shah Jahan, who built the Taj Mahal, and is almost as beautiful as the Taj Mahal. Visiting this another piece of stunning Mughal architecture was a real delightful, relaxing and highly enjoyable experience for me and the wife.

title: Sheesh Mahal
review: it is located inside the fort and is a must see. the guide tells the history in detail and one is awed by the beauty

title: Excellent
review: One of the very good place in the Fort. we spent quite good time in the fort to visit all the places.

title: Mahal of Glasses
review: It is little difficult to reach this place as it is closed most of time. You must request the authorities if they open for you.

title: A little piece of royalty!
review: although what remains is only a portion of its former glory...but it is still a beautiful sight. Walking around the Agra fort you really do feel as if you have travelled back in time.

This palace is locked up and tourists can see it only from outside. Our guide said that we can see this palace from inside if we pay 1500 rupees but we decided not to since there were so many other attractions inside the fort. The guide told us that a mesmerizing effect is produced by lightning a single candle inside the Sheesh Mahal.

title: inside jem of agra fort
review: located inside agra fort. unique and wort see. u dont need to buy an extra ticket for it. its created in a unique manner and still has a lot of charm left. u get amused by the creation of architects who made it 500 yrs before with such beauty.

title: Gives a sneak peak into the lives of Maharanis
review: Sheesh mahal or the room of mirrors is a part of Agra Fort. The room was built for the Maharanis. The mirrors give an illusion of thousands of stars shining at night.

title: ALSO KNOWN AS GLASS PALACE
review: Sheesh Mahal is one of the architectural wonders inside the Khas Mahal in Agra Fort. It was commonly used as the Summer Palace by the Mughal princes as it was structured in such a way that it kept the Mahal cool from Agra’s heat. Water devices were installed with fountains and a waterfall inside the Palace. It was originally adorned with the finest glass pieces imported from Syria in order to reflect sunlight into the thick palace walls.

title: Fantastic stucco and mirror work

title: famous for awesome glass-mosaic work
review: Sheesh Mahal situated within the Agra Fort was built by the Mughal King Shahjahan as a Summer Palace. It has two tanks with fountains, interconnected by a canal, and a water fall(Abshar). These water-devices were provided to keep it cool and comfortable in the scorching heat of Agra. The distinctive feature of this palace is the glass-mosaic work which has been done, on a wide variety of stucco designs, on all its walls and ceilings. Glass-pieces have high mirror quality. As the building is made up of thick walls with only a few openings, the semi-dark interior required artificial light, which glittered and twinkled in thousand ways through this glass-work.

title: It's amazing
review: At first I would like to admire the artist who made it. It's really awesome design. Made of whole glass. This is amazing. Great place. Recommended.

review: It is inside Agra Fort. But Locked. You can only see from outside. Even though one can imagine the glory it has.

title: Beautiful work of mirror and jewels
review: Sheesh Mahal is located inside the Agra Fort, like any other fort in northern India have similar rooms (Sheesh Mahal), It is well decorated with the fine glass work so that once the light enters into the room it will reflect on the mirrors and the whole room just lights up. It was used by the queens of the Royal families to live in, It is said that in their times the walls were actually decorated with the precious gems and diamonds, but once it was occupied by the British they took it all, you can still see the marks on the walls where these gems were taken out. For sure one of the highlight of Agra fort.

review: We were thrilled at finding the mirror Palace – Sheesh Mahal within Agra fort. Our 1st date, nearly 50 years ago was at the eponymous Glasgow restaurant which is still our favourite.

title: A hugely impressive fort complex
review: If you visit Agra, don't miss the opportunity to visit this fort (as well as the (Taj Mahal).  It is an extensive complex of palaces and courtyards with outstanding carvings and decoration.  Very well preserved, it offers an insight into the luxurious lifestyles of the Moguls in Agra.

title: Within the fort

The room was then decorated with mirrors & precious stones which glitterd and reflected the image of Taj Mahal through its east side windows. All the mirrors have now been removed. A couple of guides carry one or two small mirrors to entertain tourists. Shouldn't spend much time here..

title: Mirror Palace of Agra
review: Sheesh Mahal or Mirror Palace is a royal dressing room located inside the Agra Fort, on the western side below the Diwan-I-Khas Hall. It has tiny mirror-like glass-mosaic decorations, and drums built into the interior walls. This Palace was built by Shah Jehan as a summer palace and was used for royal bathing. The palace has two tanks with fountains interconnected by a channel and a waterfall.

title: Stunning

title: Amazing Mahal

title: Bathing place of Mumtaz mahal
review: As described by our tour guide it was the bathroom of mumtaz mahal, it contains a large sum of glasses imported from syria. When she took bath shah jahan sees her in multiple glasses.

title: Magical palace
review: Sheesh Mahal or the Glass Palace is located in Agra Fort. It was so named because of the extensive use of mirrors in its walls and ceilings set in the plaster. It was built by Shah Jehan. The effect is magnificent in a closed room with lit candles. These splendid mirrors were manufactured at Aleppo (Syria).The view on the ceiling provides us with an unlimited beauty of mirror reflection. Like a thousand stars in the sky.

title: Reminds me of the movie- Mughal-e-Azam

title: Good place
review: The Sheesh Mahal (The Palace of Mirrors; Urdu: شیش محل‎) is located within the Shah Burj block in northern-western corner of Lahore Fort. It was constructed under the reign of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1631-32. The ornate white marble pavilion is inlaid with pietra dura and complex mirror-work of the finest quality. The hall was reserved for personal use by the imperial family and close aides. It is among the 21 monuments that were built by successive Mughal emperors inside Lahore Fort, and forms the jewel in the Fort’s crown.[1] As part of the larger Lahore Fort Complex, it has been inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1981.

review: The mirrors and inlay work were very beautiful. Our guide gave us a very good history of the building and we had adequate time to take photographs. It is well worth h a visit.

title: Not much to it...
review: It pretty to look at but that's it. You can't go in it or touch it, just look and take a few snaps.

title: Good
review: A heart filled with love is

title: Special surprise
review: When I was here in 2001, someone held lit candles here inside this darkened room, in order to see the special effects created when the flames reflected upon the countless tiny mirrors inlaid up in the ceiling. Brilliant in every sense of the word! I am done. The end.

title: Impreesive but needs repair
review: One gets amazed at the architectural & engineering marvels. These were built up when construction equipment were not developed. Really amazing.

title: Possibly after the Taj Mahal, the most stunning building
review: A local guide assisted us greatly in appreciating the architecture, history and culture surrounding this wonderful place. With a little imagination, one can get a real feel for the unbelievable treasures that existed here at one time.

title: Stunning!
review: Absolutely  beautiful.  There is no way a camera can photograph the marvelous mirror work!   You will find yourself just in awe of the workmanship.

title: Lovely but closed...doors
review: This place is inside the Agra Fort. This place is full of glass work and if you light a match stick, this room will come to life. But unfortunately, ASI has closed the doors and you can merely see that from outside.

title: A work of art
review: We viewed this whilst at the Fort. It's a really fascinating place that gets you wondering how they managed to do it all. Our guide showed us the reflection with a lit match and explained the history behind it. Truly worth seeing.

title: cant take your eyes off it
review: wonderful you just cant take your eyes off it....the workmanship is outstanding......one of the best in the world that I have seen

title: Height of Luxury
review: How do you define luxury if you are sole ruler of the large kingdom of Hindustan? The answer is : Seesh Mahal!

title: Excellent Architectire!
review: Sheesh Mahal is a Royal Dressing Room located inside the Agra Fort. It features tiny mirror-like glass-mosaic decorations and drums built into the walls. Located on the western side below the Diwan-I-Khas Hall, this structure was built by Shah Jehan during 1631-40 as a summer palace and was used for imperial bathing.

title: Closed now
review: Now this place is closed for public.But when I visited this place in 2007 it was open & guide showed us with a burnt matchstick that y it is called sheesh mahal.Nice & interesting

title: Inside Agra Fort
review: A building full of mirrors and not much special is there to watch. There are mirrors everywhere on the walls and ceilings

title: Amazing!
review: On a tour of Agra, this is definitely worth a visit. So many interesting and lovely things to see, and this does not disappoint.

title: Marvellous
review: Each and every part of the Agra Fort is worth seeing and best among them is Sheesh Mahal. Be at ease when you are in the fort

title: Agra Fort- best part
review: Of course this is the best part of the Agra Fort. If you put your flashlight on to the roof of this area you will see a beautiful illumination from the mirrors. It is good to do because you can only imagine the scene back in the era. Also, try to visit the Amer Fort. Because they have a beautiful mirror similar to the image that is posted above.

title: Well worth seeing and memorable forever!
review: The mirrors on the walls and ceiling alone are worth the trip here and there is so much more to see. I loved seeing the romance reminders and the history of this sight!!

title: Mirror walls
review: Architecturally Beautiful palace situated inside Agra fort decorated   small mirror pieces beautifully fixed on walls.

title: mirrors lots of mirrors
review: The work done here was very impressive. Make sure to take a picture of your friend/significant other by using angles through the mirrors.

title: mirror, mirror on the wall, who is the ......
review: which came first, the line in the fairy tale of this place. this is a place of mirrors and one can only imagine what the inside must look like.

title: MIRROR MIRROR
review: One of its kind in the entire country. Represents the rich heritage & art the indians have. Should not miss this place.

title: Very unique!
review: This Fort was in some way different from the rest with some unique architecture. I definitely recommend visiting this place!

title: Ok
review: This is a royal bathing place. The walls and rooftops are decorated. But currently this portion is closed and visitors are not allowed. One can only get a glance of this place from outside. Nothing much to view from outside.

title: Awesome decoration
review: Sheesh Mahal is part of Agra Fort and has awesome attraction due to mirrors used in construction. Shows architecture of Mughal era.

title: Master piece of beauty
review: This palace of Agra fort is close for tourist. You cannot visit it from inside. But yes you can see it from front door. But due to not light arrangement inside it remain dark.

title: Stunning mirrored galleries
review: A highlight of a visit to the Amber Fort - super mirrored galleries radiating light, twinkling at every change of angle, leading eventually to the silver doors of the temple to the goddess Kali.

title: beautiful art
review: amazing art of the artists and creators, glitters like diamonds in dim lights. maintain the cleanliness please

title: very beautiful mahal
review: this is the most beautiful place of agra inside agra fort. this is built by shah jahan and shah jahan spent here his last year of life.

title: Inside the Agra Fort
review: Not sure why Trip Advisor has put this as separate place, it is situated in Agra Fort only so when visiting the fort don't miss. Take the audio guide and you will see it.

title: beautiful from outside
review: sheeshmahal is in agra fort near angoori baug. Beautiful architecture but closed for tourist now a days. We can only see it from outside. But how much i seen was great.

title: History worth knowing
review: the superb arrangements of glasses used to increase the light of cabdles by thousand times. some of the broken glasses pieces are still the witness of this glass house made for the beautiful mughal queens and ladies.

title: Just Ok
review: Not getting that much impressive as shish mahal in jaipur..obviously people will benchmark with that....

title: Sheesh Mahal - amazing work inside the Agra Fort
review: This Sheesh Mahal is a part of the Agra Fort and is now not fully accessible to common people. It is closed for full access by railings.

title: Mind-blowing
review: One of the most beautiful palace where used many small mirrors and precious stones to make this architect the attractive one inside the Agra Fort. This mirror palace used by the Mughal ladies during that time.

title: A nice visity
review: Its a beauty place to visit do take out time for visiting the same it will be a memorable one specially from a couple stand point.

title: Wonderful Bathroom for the queens
review: Sheesh Mahal is actually the bathroom for the queens, so one can say a royal bathroom. The decoration is fantastic. There were arrangements for hot and cold water baths and also rose water baths. Currently this particular portion is closed and public entry is not allowed.

title: Beautiful but locked !!
review: The place is absolutely stunning with mirror work all over the place but it is locked out for public these days..

title: Royal Bathing Place
review: This is a gorgeous royal bathing place where the queens used to take their baths. The walls and rooftops are beautifully decorated. But currently this portion is closed and visitors are not allowed. One can only get a glance of this place from outside.

title: Core Attracttion
review: This is inside the Agra fort. One can see when visiting Agra fort. Provides amazing feel of Moghul History.

title: Must visit
review: Amazing work of Architecture with splendid view. This is must visit place , all heard in movies . All the best.

title: Sheesh Mahal - thousands of mirrors...
review: Sheesh Mahal - a terrific place to learn part of India's rich history.  Although entrance inside is restricted, it's easy to view from the barriers and a must see...

title: Hall of Mirrors
review: its a very small place which was used by the Royalty for entertainment. Beauty of this place was that it had thousands and thousands of Mirrors (in small pieces) all over its Walls and Roofs. Some pieces of Mirrors can still be found embedded in the wall and roof. If you stand in the middle of the room, you can see thousands of your images. Primarily this room was used for Dance performance.

title: Exquisite!
review: This is part of the Agra Fort the interior walls are covered with mirrors and tiny silver tiles with carved flowers bordering the walls. Very detailed and very pretty.

title: Very good, from a distance
review: One cannot enter the Sheesh Mahal. It is closed, but can be observed from the outside. It has ornate mirror, glass work, with which it derives its name.

title: Musamman Burj.
review: it was built by shahjahan for his beloved queen Mumtaj mahal,,it is the best palace of Agra fort.its real name is musamman burj or jesmine tower.

title: Beautiful but still a prison
review: The artistry and craftmanship in the building of this is beautiful. A place of exile where the Shah was supported by 2 of his daughters, one who was unmarried at the time. The views are stunning, even more so on a clear day

title: One for the Love
review: This is the place where Shah Jahan spent his last years in exile looking at his masterpiece Taj Mahal from Agra fort. He was under house arrest by his son Aurenzeb.

title: Beautiful creative art.
review: This is one of the most beautiful parts of living quarters inside the the Red fort at Agra. The entrance to the inside has been barred to prevent physical damage. But try to take photos with a zoom camera and a flash light, You might succeed.

title: Amazing architecture
review: I have visited sheesh mahal only for 30 to 40 minutes because we have very less time to complete our visit due to flight timing, its very beautiful and attractive area under AGRA fort.

title: Very Beautiful!
review: "Sheesh" is mirror or glass in Indian language and Mahal is a Mansion(or Palace). It's full of mirrors. Very beautiful.

title: Starlit hamam!
review: Sheesh Mahal, within the precinct of the Royal Apartments at Agra Fort, is a jewel... Set with thousands of embedded glasses, it shines and glimmers like a pavilion in the starry skies ! Must see !

title: beauty of Glass
review: This place is Very Nice, this place part of Agra fort, this place made by glass, i like this place very much

title: "Palce of mirror"
review: It is also made by Shah Jehan Shish Mahal or the Glass Palace is located on the western side of the Muthamman Burj below the Diwan-i-Khas hall. Well Maintained.

title: Magnificent Architecture
review: Beautiful Mahal to visit in the Agra Fort. Not open for public it closed. can be viewed through closed grill door.

title: A Must Place to spend Time
review: An AWESOME place where you can be lost with the Artistry of Ancient People and their Art work. A perfect example of Indian Art work & dedication of People of India towards Creativity.

title: Reflects its Name
review: This place is very Beautiful situated in agra fort below the diwan-i-khas hall. This place is full of morrors and consists of two large chambers connected through a broad arched opening in the center. The most amazing thing is that both these chambers has a marble tank and fountains with hot and cold water.. Wow this place is really very good

title: Impressive.
review: Just stand here and think that you were here 400 years back when this was actually used to its full glory. Marvellous installation.

title: Made from Crafted Glass
review: Made from Crafted Glass which gives a different look of engineering of those old days.

title: Wish we could see it from inside
review: I like the story behind the structure and what the guide explained but I wish it was open to see for the public also. It is closed and you can look in through the door which has a net kind of work. The Sheesh Mahal is often confused to be a Hammam (bath place) and even our guide told us that but it's not true. The stone tablet placed by the ASI outside it states the same.

title: Very artistic and nicely detailed
review: This is now closed to the public, you can see it from grilled doors.

title: Excellent specimens of glass mosaic decoration!!!
review: Sheesh Mahal consists of two large chambers connected through a broad arched opening in the center and two narrow passages on the sides. Only light that crept in here, reached here through the two doors and a ventilator in the southern wall. Both these chambers had a marble tank with fountains.  The stucco relief work in the panels above them depict 'guldasta' or bunch of flowers in combination with glass mosaic work and contained mirrors producing a gorgeously superb effect.It is supposed to have been the royal dressing room and its walls are inlaid by means of small mirrors, one of the most excellent specimens of glass mosaic decoration in India. Entry to interiors are resticted, so you have take pics from outside only.

title: Amazing decorative
review: So BEAUTIFUL, SO incredible ~ that it'll leave your mouth open and you'll start wondering ~ what a minutely decorated art..

title: Amazing part of the Agra Fort
review: The Sheesh Mahal is located within the Agra Fort and is a glorious building in both artwork and construction.  Definitely worth exploring whilst inside the fort complex.  We were fortunate to have Raja from India Agra Travels who was not only a wealth of knowledge but a real joy to be with..one of the best tour guide experiences.

title: Beautiful Architectural work
review: "Palace of Mirrors", built by Shahjahan.This is located inside the Agra Fort,  The effect produced by lighting candles is quite beautiful and breathtaking,

title: Sheesh Mahal
review: the place just part of Agra Fort and you can see only through small window for a dark room you can not see any thing

title: The Glass Mahal
review: This one of the popular section within Agra Fort, as the name says "Sheesh Mahal", its truly symbolizes the meaning. now the rooms are barricated by the archaeological department to keep it preserve.

title: Good Example of Mughal Architecture...
review: Good Example of Mughal Architecture and a showcase of how we  Indians believe in preserving the historical monuments....

title: Peek View is the only view that you get
review: This is part of the Agra fort and is not open for public. You just have to peek through the glass door to get the view and they dont even have lit the room well to get a good peek view. It is opened only for VIP guests or by bribing the guard (as our Guide told us).

title: good place
review: this is full of greenery .when you come to this place you enjoy lots of inner green happiness. the structure of this place is quite well .if you have a guide he tells you about more of this place , good place to visit.

title: Architectural beauty
review: When looking at Sheesh Mahal, they decoration work inside and outside the building- you would wonder about how they would have built that. amazingly beautiful.

title: Don't waste your till
review: This is an abandoned place, not worth seeing it as well. better to plan something else, rather than visiting this place

title: Beautiful monument signifying the Moghul Era
review: This is a must see on your visit to the taj mahal. Do not miss it. It gives and insight into the luxurious lives of the kings and queens during the moghul era in Agra

title: Beautiful palace... visit before it loses its charm
review: It is one of the most beautiful palaces to visit in Agra. However, due to people pulling out the glassed from walls, access to this palace has been restricted of late. Despite incidences of vandalism, the palace remains beautiful as ever!

title: Sheesh Mahal Inside The Agra Fort | Near Muthamman Burj, Agra, India
review: What a beautiful place I been there.....!! I like so much and that is amazing. Unfortunately..I am alone there and I missed my friends and family.

title: Amazing effect with the candles
review: We wouldn't have known about this as the area was closed when we were there. However the local guide asked if we wanted to see it but we would have to provide a tip to the guard to unlock the gate. It's totally dark inside for a reason and when you light up the candles, the effect is stunning. We were amazed at the creativity and ingenuity of it all.

title: No words really
review: No words can explain the beautify it offers, one loses sense of time and even self when looking at it. Its beautiful and i m glad i had chance to visit it

title: tacky bollywood decor
review: I think the cricket match was more interesting than serving their customers and without an exaggeration there were about

title: Mahal at it best
review: one of the finest example of Moghul art and structure. This area is closed by the government but  guards taking some bribe allow the visitors to see this which is a bad practice.

title: Closed to public due to behaviour of people
review: amazing place where mughal queens and princess used to change dress and makeup room, also the room is used during winter time,also might be used for baths by imperial women,the mirros were bought from aleppo syria

title: stunning architecture
review: we were told by our guide that the ceiling was made up of special curved glass brought all the way from Belgium, the only place producing glass like that at that time.  I think the 16 century.  the light reflecting off the glass would cast different hues around the room at different times of day.

title: True Gem in Agra Fort
review: Brillinat Architecture. Thousands of small mirrors in a big room. Will remember you of Saleem & Anarkali. Although it is closed for general public you can watch it from outside. Must watch!!!

title: A gem inside Agra Fort
review: This is truly a gem inside Agra Fort - and amazed me with its magical charm. Only I wish it were better maintained and had even a small descriptive signage for the tourist!

title: Wow! is the word
review: Sheesh Mahal is located in the Agra Fort, closed to public. We were lucky that we got an entry into it. The place is like magic. Thousands of convex glass pieces lined with silver fixed on the ceiling reflect the light that is lit in the rooms. The rooms are the bathing quarters of the queen who had one spa of cold water and the other of hot water... all done with the help of lamps. Difficult to put in words that which we saw but if you do get an opportunity of seeing it don't miss it.

title: Unknown treasure
review: I am embarrassed to say we had not even heard of this monument but it was beautiful and very interesting.  If the Taj Majal did not exist everyone would be raving over this little jewel.

title: Beautiful Glass Structure inside Agra Fort
review: The Sheesh Mahal is a beautiful palace located inside Agra Fort. I think this the most beautiful one in side the Agra Fort. Now-a-days none can go in inside to see it's beauty but you can see from outside through the grilled gate.

title: Be sure to have a knowledgable guide
review: We were so lucky to have a great guide. Walking through the Fort stopping at the amazing interior Palace rooms was really enhanced by our guide. Having him point out how they carved the marble and then inlaid with the semi-precious stones was great. The combination of the wonderful workmanship and a detailed history of India during this timeframe really enhanced our visit.

title: Stunning
review: Feast for the eyes well worth a visit  stunning place .

title: Elegance in Rustic Amber Fort
review: Sheesh Mahal is a touch of elegance within the palace courtyard. Exoctic artful masterly detailed mirror & glass mosaic pattern inlay surface finish. Elegant, exquisite & affluent.

title: Beautiful Glass and Architecture
review: This Palace inside Agra Fort is stunning. The Palace was built by Mughal Shahjahan between 1631-40. The stunning glass was imported from Syria to make a high mirror effect and it is beautiful giving a high light quality. Beautiful inlaid work in marble too.

title: Fine glass mosaics as a change
review: In Rajasthan you might become a bit spoiled by all fantastic pietra dura mosaics. These glittering glass mosaics are a nice change. Must have looked magic during festive nights lighted by candles.

title: Agra Fort
review: Part of Agra Fort and the Taj  Mahal story.  Knowing the story will  enhance your experience immensly. Some sort of information guide should be  used to help you as there are not many storyboards.

title: A must see place
review: This is a must visit place in Agra fort... The architecture is mesmerising and place has an eternal beauty... Extreme delight to watch the place surrounded by so many mirrors...

title: Difficult to see
review: It's hard to look inside and get a feel for the Sheesh Mahal. There are a number of these throughout India and this was probably the hardest to see and appreciate.

review: we were told by our guide that the ceiling was made up of special curved glass brought all the way from Belgium, the only place producing glass like that at that time.  I think the 16 century.  the light reflecting off the glass would cast different hues around the room at different times of day.

title: Beautiful Glass and Architecture
review: This Palace inside Agra Fort is stunning. The Palace was built by Mughal Shahjahan between 1631-40. The stunning glass was imported from Syria to make a high mirror effect and it is beautiful giving a high light quality. Beautiful inlaid work in marble too.

title: Difficult to see
review: It's hard to look inside and get a feel for the Sheesh Mahal. There are a number of these throughout India and this was probably the hardest to see and appreciate.

title: Elegance in Rustic Amber Fort
review: Sheesh Mahal is a touch of elegance within the palace courtyard. Exoctic artful masterly detailed mirror & glass mosaic pattern inlay surface finish. Elegant, exquisite & affluent.

title: Beautiful Glass Structure inside Agra Fort
review: The Sheesh Mahal is a beautiful palace located inside Agra Fort. I think this the most beautiful one in side the Agra Fort. Now-a-days none can go in inside to see it's beauty but you can see from outside through the grilled gate.

title: Fine glass mosaics as a change
review: In Rajasthan you might become a bit spoiled by all fantastic pietra dura mosaics. These glittering glass mosaics are a nice change. Must have looked magic during festive nights lighted by candles.

title: Difficult to see
review: It's hard to look inside and get a feel for the Sheesh Mahal. There are a number of these throughout India and this was probably the hardest to see and appreciate.

title: Be sure to have a knowledgable guide
review: We were so lucky to have a great guide. Walking through the Fort stopping at the amazing interior Palace rooms was really enhanced by our guide. Having him point out how they carved the marble and then inlaid with the semi-precious stones was great. The combination of the wonderful workmanship and a detailed history of India during this timeframe really enhanced our visit.

title: Agra Fort
review: Part of Agra Fort and the Taj  Mahal story.  Knowing the story will  enhance your experience immensly. Some sort of information guide should be  used to help you as there are not many storyboards.
